attributes.action: Negotiate sustainable catch limits for all 5 UK cod stocks with the EU in 2022.
attributes.background: There are five cod stocks around the UK, all of which are overfished. Four are so badly overfished that populations are at risk of collapse. Every year, catch limits are determined in negotiations between the UK, EU and Norway and every year the UK ignores the science and allows overfishing.
attributes.additional_details: We need thriving cod populations around the UK for the health of our seas, our people and our businesses that depend on cod. However, the situation is dire. The West Scotland cod population alone has declined by 92% since 1981. Despite continued warnings about the perilous condition of the stock, the UK set catch limits far above sustainable levels. The UK must set catch limits at sustainable levels to allow cod populations to replenish themselves and flourish in our seas, for us all.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Ban the use of super trawlers in UK waters
attributes.background: We are interested in the banning of super trawlers to take a step in the right direction to heal one of our most important ecosystems. We hope this will help regulate overfishing in UK waters, and reduce the amount of fishing related plastic waste in the British Isles.
attributes.additional_details: The ocean is currently being grossly overfished, destroying many vital ecosystems which are necessary for all human life. Banning the use of super trawlers would take a very important step to healing the ocean floor, would greatly reduce fishing related plastic waste that pollutes our own waters and the ocean as a whole, and finally, would also contribute to the prevention of the accidental fishing of dolphins, sharks, and whales off of our coastline.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Overfishing and dumping of fish nets is destroying the planet and this must stop
attributes.background: The government should introduce laws to limit fishing and pressure other countries to do the same. There is no accountability for the illegal overfishing. Fishing corporations are getting away with dumping nets and damaging the Ocean. New measures should be introduced to track and stop this.
attributes.additional_details: Dumping of fish nets and fishing equipment is responsible for over 50% of pollution in the ocean and politicians are protecting these corporations and enabling the destruction of Earth. Climate change will be accelerated if overfishing continues and something must be done to change this.

attributes.background: 200 million tons of fish are produced for food each year, both from the wild and from fish farms. Fish are sentient beings; they feel pain, like we mammals do. They are not vegetables. They have lives that matter. Also, overfishing is ruining the ecosystems and decimating fish populations.
attributes.additional_details:
Fish do not deserve to be caught. They deserve to have their lives respected, just as we would respect the life of a dog or cat, or another human, or our own life.
 
Overfishing also depletes fish stocks available to seabirds and other ocean predators.
 
We need to stop catching and killing fish, and also farming fish. We need to let the oceans and their wildlife recover and stop the violence against innocent fish.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Help save our ocean and end government funding towards overfishing.
attributes.background: To help end overfishing, the uk needs to end funding towards the fishing industry. Preserving the ocean by having more guarded and regulated No take zones in the uk oceans. Allowing healthy Marnie life to thrive in our ocean, will have positive effects on endangered species and climate change.
attributes.additional_details:
The uk government has funded over £100 million towards fishing, which is then sold to the consumer as 'sustainable'. The 'sustainable' fishing is killing and endangering not only Marnie life that is intended to be caught but a huge amount of Marnie life is suffering from bycatching. Wild Mammals starving as a result of no fish. 
Marnie life intake our co2 emissions and cool down the climate and produce over 50% of our oxygen. To help support climate change we need to take action on overfishing.

attributes.action: Ban Overfishing of Sharks -  Up to 100 Million Sharks are Killed Yearly
attributes.background: Overfishing sharks disrupts the ocean's ecosystem & the health of our planet. With the decline of sharks, existing predators will increase, leaving scarce fish for human consumption. With the indirect control of species, sharks are able to protect seagrass which removes carbon from the atmosphere.
attributes.additional_details:
Sharks are vital to us, and our planet, which is why we must do what we can to protect them. 

More info:  https://oceanconservationtrust.org/why-sharks-are-vitally-important-to-ocean-health/

https://www.forbes.com/sites/melissacristinamarquez/2020/07/28/sharks-are-becoming-functionally-extinct-around-the-world/

https://www.greenpeace.org/international/story/46967/100-million-dead-sharks-its-not-all-about-shark-fin-soup/

rejection.details:

In addition, the UK Government is only responsible for rules governing fishing in UK waters.

attributes.background: Ban the use of commercial fishing boats for a minimum of 4 years to stop over fishing destroying the oceans and our planet any further
attributes.additional_details:
Our oceans are over fished. Commercial fishing is a leading environmental issue and if commercial fishing continues at the rate it is today there will be empty oceans by 2048. 46% of plastic waste in the ocean is fishing nets and other fishing gear.
 By banning commercial fishing until at least 2025 we can see a significant reduction in plastic waste in the ocean and stop overfishing in an attempt to reduce the damage already done

attributes.action: Ban the import of shark fins and the selling of shark fin soup in the UK
attributes.background: Ban the import of shark fins to the UK which are being used in the hospitality sector and to ban restaurants from making and selling shark fin soup on their menu
attributes.additional_details: Sharks are an incredibly endangered species and many are being overfished to meet the demand for shark fins. When sharks are fished and finned, the process can be a brutal one and it seems an unnecessary waste of life for such a small dish in a restaurant (only 5% of the shark is used for the dish). The petition has been brought up previously but has been rejected for various reasons which have now changed.

attributes.action: Stop subsidising the fishing industry with taxpayers money.
attributes.background: Stop subsidising fishing trade and focus the taxpayers money on conserving our oceans and its wildlife..
attributes.additional_details: The statistics are plain to see, not just overfishing and plastic waste in our oceans from discarded fishing equipment, but the humanitarian crisis in the Asian fishing trade and the piracy in African waters. So called marine charities that are supposed to be regulating safe and sustainable fishing only exist to profit from the mass fishing in the first place! If the fishing industry cant support itself then its obviously time for the industry to die, just as you allowed with the coal industry.

attributes.action: Save and Protect Our Oceans From Commercial Overfishing
attributes.background: We need the government to take action when it comes to commercial fishing and the destruction of planets oceans and seas. 90% of the world's largest fish have now been wiped out and 3.9 billion acres of the seafloor is deforested every year by trawling. It is killing our home, earth.
attributes.additional_details:
The government needs to act fast, we must:

Set up no-catch marine reserves immediately - a short term goal of protecting 30% of our ocean by 2030.

End all UK fishing subsidies, saving hundreds of millions in taxpayers funding, which props up this most destructive industry.

Our oceans are dying, we cannot survive without our oceans, we must act before it is too late. 300,000 dolphins, whales and porpoises are killed in fishing nets every year along with 30,000 sharks a day. We have to act now.

UK to work with Global organisations to tackle this crisis.
attributes.additional_details:
Fishing vessels use thirty-mile fishing lines with baited hooks, 300,000 dolphins, whales and porpoises are killed yearly. 3.9 billion acres of seafloor is deforested yearly by trawling.46% of the pacific garbage patch is comprised of fishing nets. Fish farming is associated with infectious diseases and welfare abuses. Sustainable fishing is corrupt. 

The seas are most powerful carbon sinks in the world and most important support system for life on earth and preventing climate change.

attributes.action: Plant coral forests and save existing coral forests.
attributes.background:
Coral reefs are dying around the world. Damaging activities include coral mining, pollution, overfishing, blast fishing, the digging of canals and access into islands and bays. Climate change, such as warming temperatures, causes coral bleaching, which if severe kills the coral.
STOP THIS!!!!
attributes.additional_details: Coral trees absorb 4 times as much carbon dioxide as trees do!!! This means that coral forests are 4 times more valuable than forests.
